oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The Gum Elastic Fire and Water Proof Asbestos Paint
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. Users are solely responsible for determining the existence of such instances and for obtaining any other permissions and paying associated fees that may be necessary for the intended use.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Circular featuring testimonials of "Gum Elastic Fire and Water Proof Asbestos Paint" on roofs, all attesting to its durabilitiy and cheapness. The advertisement says the paint is for sale by J. K. Trotter.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Broadsides
Broadsides; Paint; Paint, Fireproof; Asbestos
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: J. K. Trotter
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Asbestos is a naturally occurring mineral with high tolerance to heat. It became popular in the 19th Century as a fire-prevention agent. Its use was banned in the United States in 1989 after scientists concluded that exposure to asbestos particles causes mesothelioma.
